CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 12, 1952, pg. 34 reads: "New Electives Take Office - Two of the most controversial candidates but winners in the Nov. 6 elections attracted enormous crowds to the court house on Jan. 4 and 7. District Attorney James F. Malone Jr. took the oath of office Jan. 4 and State Senator John M. Walker was sworn in Jan. 7 as a minority member of the Board of County Commissioners.  Both are Republicans...One the right are James F. Malone, his wife Helen and 8-year-old son, James F. III, as they settled down to the task of being greeted by over two thousand people and acceding to requests of numerous photographers. Max Rogal, friend of the Malone family, is shown in the rear center. Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Helen Malone and son James F. Malone III standing next to District Attorney James F. Malone, shaking hands with woman wearing houndstooth coat, with Max Rogal wearing bow tie in background, standing in Allegheny County Courthouse for swearing in ceremony
